result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Antonio Allison

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

9:36 AM Defendant Thomas Antonio Allison in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Thomas Antonio Allison.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State files a bond modification.  State makes further argument.  Defense objects with argument.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  BTC: Bond modification granted to an additional $2500 cash.  Cash bond set at $7500 total, same conditions. Defendant makes further statement and apologizes to the court.  **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.**
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas Antonio Allison in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Thomas Antonio Allison. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State files a bond motion.  Defense makes argument on bond.  Defendant is in treatment.  State makes argument and asks for significant cash.  Defense rebuttal.  BTC: Bond modified to a $5000 cash bond, same conditions. **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**
